Define an 8-bit output register to hold the reversed bits of the input.

Retrieved Related Information:
- in: 8-bit input signal
- out: 8-bit output signal where the bit ordering of 'in' is reversed
Assign the least significant bit of the input to the most significant bit of the output register.

Assign the second least significant bit of the input to the second most significant bit of the output register.

Continue assigning each bit from the input to the reversed position in the output register until all bits are assigned.
